bgpM2.name: bgpM2
bgpM2.contactinfo: E-mail: idr@merit.net Jeffrey Haas (Editor) 825 Victors Way, Suite 100 Ann Arbor, MI 48108 Tel: +1 734 222-1600 Fax: +1 734 222-1602 E-mail: jhaas@nexthop.com
bgpM2.description: This MIB module defines management objects for the Border Gateway Protocol, Version 4.

BgpM2Identifier.name: BgpM2Identifier
BgpM2Identifier.description: The representation of a BGP Identifier. The BGP Identifier should be represented in the OCTET STRING as with the first OCTET of the string containing the first OCTET of the BGP Identifier received or sent in the OPEN packet and so on. Even though the BGP Identifier is trending away from an IP address it is still displayed as if it was one, even when it would be an illegal IP address.

BgpM2Afi.name: BgpM2Afi
BgpM2Afi.description: The representation of a BGP AFI

BgpM2Safi.name: BgpM2Safi
BgpM2Safi.description: The representation of a BGP SAFI

BgpM2Community.name: BgpM2Community
BgpM2Community.description: The representation of a BGP Community.

BgpM2ExtendedCommunity.name: BgpM2ExtendedCommunity
BgpM2ExtendedCommunity.description: The representation of a BGP Extended Community.

bgpM2Established.name: bgpM2Established
bgpM2Established.description: The BGP Established event is generated when the BGP FSM enters the ESTABLISHED state.

bgpM2BackwardTransition.name: bgpM2BackwardTransition
bgpM2BackwardTransition.description: The BGPBackwardTransition Event is generated when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state.

bgpM2VersionEntry.name: bgpM2VersionEntry
bgpM2VersionEntry.description: Entry containing data on a given supported version of the Border Gateway Protocol and the level of support provided. It is expected that any agent implementation supporting this MIB module will report support for Version 4 of the Border Gateway Protocol at the very minimum.

bgpM2VersionIndex.name: bgpM2VersionIndex
bgpM2VersionIndex.description: The version number of the BGP Protocol.

bgpM2VersionSupported.name: bgpM2VersionSupported
bgpM2VersionSupported.description: This value is TRUE if this version of the BGP protocol identified in 'bgpM2VersionIndex' is supported. The absence of a row for a particular bgpM2VersionIndex indicates that that bgpM2VersionIndex protocol version number is not supported.

bgpM2CapabilitySupportAvailable.name: bgpM2CapabilitySupportAvailable
bgpM2CapabilitySupportAvailable.description: This value is TRUE if capability support is available and is enabled.

bgpM2SupportedCapabilitiesEntry.name: bgpM2SupportedCapabilitiesEntry
bgpM2SupportedCapabilitiesEntry.description: Information about supported capabilities indexed by capability number.

bgpM2SupportedCapabilityCode.name: bgpM2SupportedCapabilityCode
bgpM2SupportedCapabilityCode.description: Index of supported capability. The index directly corresponds with the BGP-4 Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

bgpM2SupportedCapability.name: bgpM2SupportedCapability
bgpM2SupportedCapability.description: This value is True if this capability is supported, False otherwise.

bgpM2AsSize.name: bgpM2AsSize
bgpM2AsSize.description: The size of the AS value in this implementation. The semantics of this are determined as per the as-4bytes draft.

bgpM2LocalAs.name: bgpM2LocalAs
bgpM2LocalAs.description: The local autonomous system number. If the bgpM2AsSize is twoOctet, then the range is constrained to be 0-65535.

bgpM2LocalIdentifier.name: bgpM2LocalIdentifier
bgpM2LocalIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of local system. Current practice is trending away from this value being treated as an IP address and more as a generic identifier.

bgpM2RouteReflector.name: bgpM2RouteReflector
bgpM2RouteReflector.description: This value is TRUE if this implementation supports the BGP Route Reflection Extension and is enabled as a route reflector. If the BGP Route Reflection extension is not supported this value must be FALSE.

bgpM2ClusterId.name: bgpM2ClusterId
bgpM2ClusterId.description: The configured Cluster-ID of the BGP Speaker. This will default to the BGP Speaker's BgpM2Identifier if this speaker is functioning as a route reflector and an explicit Cluster-ID has not been configured. A value of 0.0.0.0 will be present if Route Reflection is not enabled.

bgpM2ConfederationRouter.name: bgpM2ConfederationRouter
bgpM2ConfederationRouter.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
bgpM2ConfederationRouter.description: This value is TRUE if this implementation supports the BGP AS Confederations Extension and this router is configured to be in a confederation.

bgpM2ConfederationId.name: bgpM2ConfederationId
bgpM2ConfederationId.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
bgpM2ConfederationId.description: The local Confederation Identification Number. This value will be zero (0) if this BGP Speaker is not a confederation router.

bgpM2CfgBaseScalarStorageType.name: bgpM2CfgBaseScalarStorageType
bgpM2CfgBaseScalarStorageType.description: This object specifies the intended storage type for all configurable base scalars.

bgpM2CfgLocalAs.name: bgpM2CfgLocalAs
bgpM2CfgLocalAs.description: The local autonomous system number. If the bgpM2AsSize is twoOctet, then the range is constrained to be 0-65535.

bgpM2CfgLocalIdentifier.name: bgpM2CfgLocalIdentifier
bgpM2CfgLocalIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of local system. Current practice is trending away from this value being treated as an IP address and more as a generic identifier.

bgpM2CfgRouteReflector.name: bgpM2CfgRouteReflector
bgpM2CfgRouteReflector.description: This value is set to true if this implementation will be supporting route reflection.

bgpM2CfgClusterId.name: bgpM2CfgClusterId
bgpM2CfgClusterId.description: The configured Cluster-ID of the BGP Speaker. This will default to the BGP Speaker's BgpM2Identifier if this speaker is functioning as a route reflector and an explicit Cluster-ID has not been configured. A value of 0.0.0.0 will be present if Route Reflection is not enabled.

bgpM2CfgConfederationRouter.name: bgpM2CfgConfederationRouter
bgpM2CfgConfederationRouter.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
bgpM2CfgConfederationRouter.description: This value is set to true if this implementation will be supporting BGP AS Confederations.

bgpM2CfgConfederationId.name: bgpM2CfgConfederationId
bgpM2CfgConfederationId.reference: RFC 3065 - Autonomous System Confederations for BGP
bgpM2CfgConfederationId.description: The local Confederation Identification Number. This value will be zero (0) if this BGP Speaker is not a confederation router.

bgpM2PeerTable.name: bgpM2PeerTable
bgpM2PeerTable.description: BGP peer table. This table contains, one entry per remote BGP peer, any information about the connections with the remote BGP peers.

bgpM2PeerEntry.name: bgpM2PeerEntry
bgpM2PeerEntry.description: Entry containing information about the connection with a remote BGP peer.

bgpM2PeerInstance.name: bgpM2PeerInstance
bgpM2PeerInstance.description: The routing instance index. Some BGP implementations permit the creation of multiple instances of a BGP routing process. An example includes RFC 2547 PE-CE routers. Implementations that do not support multiple routing instances should return 1 for this object. XXX TODO - We need to provide a way to configure these in the peer configuration table.

bgpM2PeerIdentifier.name: bgpM2PeerIdentifier
bgpM2PeerIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of this entry's remote BGP peer. This entry should be 0.0.0.0 unless the bgpM2PeerState is in the OpenConfirm or the Established state.

bgpM2PeerState.name: bgpM2PeerState
bgpM2PeerState.description: The remote BGP peer's FSM state.

bgpM2PeerStatus.name: bgpM2PeerStatus
bgpM2PeerStatus.description: Whether or not the BGP FSM for this remote peer is halted or running. The BGP FSM for a remote peer is halted after processing a Stop event. Likewise, it is in the running state after a Start event. The bgpM2PeerState will generally be in the idle state when the FSM is halted, although some extensions such as Graceful Restart will leave the peer in the Idle state but with the FSM running.

bgpM2PeerConfiguredVersion.name: bgpM2PeerConfiguredVersion
bgpM2PeerConfiguredVersion.description: The configured version to originally start with this remote peer. The BGP speaker may permit negotiation to a lower version number of the protocol.

bgpM2PeerNegotiatedVersion.name: bgpM2PeerNegotiatedVersion
bgpM2PeerNegotiatedVersion.description: The negotiated version of BGP running between the two peers.

bgpM2PeerLocalAddrType.name: bgpM2PeerLocalAddrType
bgpM2PeerLocalAddrType.description: The address family of the local end of the peering session.

bgpM2PeerLocalAddr.name: bgpM2PeerLocalAddr
bgpM2PeerLocalAddr.description: The address of the local end of the peering session.

bgpM2PeerLocalPort.name: bgpM2PeerLocalPort
bgpM2PeerLocalPort.description: The local port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers.

bgpM2PeerLocalAs.name: bgpM2PeerLocalAs
bgpM2PeerLocalAs.description: Some implementations of BGP can represent themselves as multiple ASs. This is the AS that this peering session is representing itself as to the remote peer.

bgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType.name: bgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType
bgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType.description: The address family of the remote end of the peering session.

bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr.name: bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr
bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr.description: The address of the remote end of the peering session.

bgpM2PeerRemotePort.name: bgpM2PeerRemotePort
bgpM2PeerRemotePort.reference: RFC 2012 - SNMPv2 Management Information Base for the Transmission Control Protocol using SMIv2. RFC 2542 - IP Version 6 Management Information Base for the Transmission Control Protocol.
bgpM2PeerRemotePort.description: The remote port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers. In the case of a transport for which the notion of 'port' is irrelevant, an instance value of -1 should be returned by the agent for this object. Note that the objects bgpM2PeerLocalAddr, bgpM2PeerLocalPort, bgpM2PeerRemoteAddr and bgpM2PeerRemotePort provide the appropriate reference to the standard MIB TCP connection table. or even the ipv6 TCP MIB as in rfc2452.

bgpM2PeerIndex.name: bgpM2PeerIndex
bgpM2PeerIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the remote peer entry in the bgpM2PeerTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the bgpM2PeerTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of bgpM2PeerIndex row instance values across rows of the bgpM2PeerTable. It is used to provide an index structure for other tables whose data is logically per-peer. For explicitly configured peers, this value will remain consistent until this row is deleted by deleting the configured peers. Unconfigured peers will generate a monotonically increasing number when a BGP FSM is built to process the peering session. Values in the bgpM2PeerTable and other tables utilizing bgpM2PeerIndex are expected to remain in existence for an arbitrary time after the unconfigured peer has been deleted in order to allow management applications to extract useful management information for those peers. Thus, an unconfigured peer using the same indices as the bgpM2PeerTable that comes up while this row still exists will re-utilize the same row.

bgpM2PeerErrorsTable.name: bgpM2PeerErrorsTable
bgpM2PeerErrorsTable.description: On a per peer basis, this table reflects the last protocol-defined error encountered and reported on the peer session. If no entry for a given peer, by its bgpM2PeerIndex, exists in this table, then no such errors have been observed, reported, and recorded on the session.

bgpM2PeerErrorsEntry.name: bgpM2PeerErrorsEntry
bgpM2PeerErrorsEntry.description: Each entry contains information about errors sent and received for a particular BGP peer.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived
bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived.description: The last error code and subcode received by this BGP Speaker via a NOTIFICATION message for this peer. If no error has occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code, and the second byte contains the subcode.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorSent.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorSent
bgpM2PeerLastErrorSent.description: The last error code and subcode sent by this BGP Speaker via a NOTIFICATION message to this peer. If no error has occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code, and the second byte contains the subcode.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime
bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime.description: The timestamp that the last NOTIFICATION was received from this peer.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentTime.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentTime
bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentTime.description: The timestamp that the last NOTIFICATION was sent to this peer.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText
bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText.description: This object contains an implementation specific explanation of the error that was reported.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentText.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentText
bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentText.description: This object contains an implementation specific explanation of the error that is being reported.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedData.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedData
bgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedData.description: The last error code's data seen by this peer.

bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentData.name: bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentData
bgpM2PeerLastErrorSentData.description: The last error code's data sent to this peer.

bgpM2PeerEventTimesTable.name: bgpM2PeerEventTimesTable
bgpM2PeerEventTimesTable.description: A table reporting the per-peering session amount of time elapsed and update events since the peering session advanced into the Established state.

bgpM2PeerEventTimesEntry.name: bgpM2PeerEventTimesEntry
bgpM2PeerEventTimesEntry.description: Each row contains a set of statistics about time spent and events encountered in the peer session Established state.

bgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTime.name: bgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTime
bgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTime.description: This timer indicates how long (in seconds) this peer has been in the Established state or how long since this peer was last in the Established state. It is set to zero when a new peer is configured or the router is booted.

bgpM2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime.name: bgpM2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime
bgpM2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime.description: Elapsed time in seconds since the last BGP UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time bgpM2PeerInUpdates is incremented, the value of this object is set to zero (0). This value shall also be zero (0) when the peer is not in the Established state

bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable.name: bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable
bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable.description: Per peer management data on BGP session timers.

bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry.name: bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry
bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry.description: Each entry corresponds to the current state of BGP timers on a given peering session.

bgpM2PeerConnectRetryInterval.name: bgpM2PeerConnectRetryInterval
bgpM2PeerConnectRetryInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the ConnectRetry timer. The suggested value for this timer is 120 seconds.

bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured.name: bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured
bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the Hold Time configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. This value is placed in an OPEN message sent to this peer by this BGP speaker, and is compared with the Hold Time field in an OPEN message received from the peer when determining the Hold Time (bgpM2PeerHoldTime) with the peer. This value must not be less than three seconds if it is not zero (0) in which case the Hold Time is NOT to be established with the peer. The suggested value for this timer is 90 seconds.

bgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured.name: bgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured
bgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the KeepAlive timer configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. The value of this object will only determine the KEEPALIVE messages frequency relative to the value specified in bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured; the actual time interval for the KEEPALIVE messages is indicated by bgpM2PeerKeepAlive. A reasonable maximum value for this timer would be configured to be one third of that of bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), no periodical KEEPALIVE messages are sent to the peer after the BGP connection has been established. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

bgpM2PeerMinASOrigInterval.name: bgpM2PeerMinASOrigInterval
bgpM2PeerMinASOrigInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinASOriginationInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 15 seconds.

bgpM2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval.name: bgpM2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval
bgpM2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

bgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable.name: bgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable
bgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable.description: Current values of per-peer timers which can be dynamically set in the bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable. Values reflected in this table are the current operational values, after negotiation from values derived from initial configuration or last set from bgpM2PeerConfiguredTimersTable row instances.

bgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.name: bgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry
bgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.description: Each entry reflects a value of the currently operational, negotiated timers as reflected in the BgpM2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.

bgpM2PeerHoldTime.name: bgpM2PeerHoldTime
bgpM2PeerHoldTime.description: The value of this object is calculated by this BGP Speaker as being; zero (0) - if this was the value sent by the peer and this value is permitted by this BGP Speaker. In this case, no keepalive messages are sent and the Hold Timer is not set. At least three (3). This value is the smaller of the value sent by this peer in the OPEN message and bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured for this peer. This value is only defined when the peering session is in the Established state.

bgpM2PeerKeepAlive.name: bgpM2PeerKeepAlive
bgpM2PeerKeepAlive.description: Time interval in seconds for the KeepAlive timer established with the peer. The value of this object is calculated by this BGP speaker such that, when compared with bgpM2PeerHoldTime, it has the same proportion as what bgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured has when compared with bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), it indicates that the KeepAlive timer has not been established with the peer, or, the value of bgpM2PeerKeepAliveConfigured is zero (0). This value is only defined when the peering session is in the Established state.

bgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedTable.name: bgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedTable
bgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedTable.description: This table contains the capabilities that are supported for a given peer.

bgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedEntry.name: bgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedEntry
bgpM2PeerCapsAnnouncedEntry.description: These entries are keyed by a BGP-4 peer remote address and the BGP Capability Code

bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedCode.name: bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedCode
bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedCode.description: The BGP Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedIndex.name: bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedIndex
bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedIndex.description: Multiple instances of a given capability may be sent bgp a BGP speaker. This variable is used to index them.

bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedValue.name: bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedValue
bgpM2PeerCapAnnouncedValue.description: The value of the announced capability.

bgpM2PeerCapsReceivedTable.name: bgpM2PeerCapsReceivedTable
bgpM2PeerCapsReceivedTable.description: This table contains the capabilities that are supported for a given peer.

bgpM2PeerCapsReceivedEntry.name: bgpM2PeerCapsReceivedEntry
bgpM2PeerCapsReceivedEntry.description: These entries are keyed by a BGP-4 peer remote address and the BGP Capability Code

bgpM2PeerCapReceivedCode.name: bgpM2PeerCapReceivedCode
bgpM2PeerCapReceivedCode.description: The BGP Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

bgpM2PeerCapReceivedIndex.name: bgpM2PeerCapReceivedIndex
bgpM2PeerCapReceivedIndex.description: Multiple instances of a given capability may be sent bgp a BGP speaker. This variable is used to index them.

bgpM2PeerCapReceivedValue.name: bgpM2PeerCapReceivedValue
bgpM2PeerCapReceivedValue.description: The value of the announced capability.

bgpM2PeerCountersTable.name: bgpM2PeerCountersTable
bgpM2PeerCountersTable.description: The counters associated with a BGP Peer.

bgpM2PeerCountersEntry.name: bgpM2PeerCountersEntry
bgpM2PeerCountersEntry.description: Each entry contains counters of message transmissions and FSM transitions for a given BGP Peering session.

bgpM2PeerInUpdates.name: bgpM2PeerInUpdates
bgpM2PeerInUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages received on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero (0) when the connection is established.

bgpM2PeerOutUpdates.name: bgpM2PeerOutUpdates
bgpM2PeerOutUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages transmitted on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero (0) when the connection is established.

bgpM2PeerInTotalMessages.name: bgpM2PeerInTotalMessages
bgpM2PeerInTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages received from the remote peer on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

bgpM2PeerOutTotalMessages.name: bgpM2PeerOutTotalMessages
bgpM2PeerOutTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages transmitted to the remote peer on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

bgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTrans.name: bgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTrans
bgpM2PeerFsmEstablishedTrans.description: The total number of times the BGP FSM transitioned into the established state for this peer.

bgpM2PrefixCountersTable.name: bgpM2PrefixCountersTable
bgpM2PrefixCountersTable.description: Additional per-peer, per AFI SAFI counters for prefixes

bgpM2PrefixCountersEntry.name: bgpM2PrefixCountersEntry
bgpM2PrefixCountersEntry.description: Entry containing information about a bgp-peers prefix counters.

bgpM2PrefixCountersAfi.name: bgpM2PrefixCountersAfi
bgpM2PrefixCountersAfi.description: The AFI index of the per-peer, per prefix counters

bgpM2PrefixCountersSafi.name: bgpM2PrefixCountersSafi
bgpM2PrefixCountersSafi.description: The SAFI index of the per-peer, per prefix counters

bgpM2PrefixInPrefixes.name: bgpM2PrefixInPrefixes
bgpM2PrefixInPrefixes.description: The number of prefixes received from a peer and are stored in the Adj-Ribs-In for that peer.

bgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted.name: bgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted
bgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in the Adj-Ribs-In and are eligible to become active in the Loc-Rib.

bgpM2PrefixInPrefixesRejected.name: bgpM2PrefixInPrefixesRejected
bgpM2PrefixInPrefixesRejected.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in the Adj-Ribs-In and are NOT eligible to become active in the Loc-Rib.

bgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes.name: bgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes
bgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in that peers Adj-Ribs-Out.

bgpM2PeerReflectorClientTable.name: bgpM2PeerReflectorClientTable
bgpM2PeerReflectorClientTable.description: Table of route reflection client settings on a per-peer basis.

bgpM2PeerReflectorClientEntry.name: bgpM2PeerReflectorClientEntry
bgpM2PeerReflectorClientEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a route reflector client.

bgpM2PeerReflectorClient.name: bgpM2PeerReflectorClient
bgpM2PeerReflectorClient.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is a reflector client of this router, or not. A value of nonClient indicates that this peer is not a reflector client. A value of client indicates that this peer is a reflector client that is not fully meshed with other reflector clients. A value of meshedClient indicates that the peer is a reflector client and is fully meshed with all other reflector clients. This value must be nonClient (0) for BGP external peers.

bgpM2PeerConfedMemberTable.name: bgpM2PeerConfedMemberTable
bgpM2PeerConfedMemberTable.description: Table of confederation member settings on a per-peer basis.

bgpM2PeerConfedMemberEntry.name: bgpM2PeerConfedMemberEntry
bgpM2PeerConfedMemberEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a BGP confederation member.

bgpM2PeerConfedMember.name: bgpM2PeerConfedMember
bgpM2PeerConfedMember.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is in our confederation or not.

bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusTable.name: bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusTable
bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusTable.description: Table containing rows for administratively starting and stopping peering sessions.

bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusEntry.name: bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusEntry
bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatusEntry.description: Entry containing row for administratively starting and stopping peers.

bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatus.name: bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatus
bgpM2CfgPeerAdminStatus.description: This object allows the Manual Stop and Manual Start events to be sent to an activated peering session.

bgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex.name: bgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex
bgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex.description: This object contains the next appropriate value to use as an index for creation of a row instance in in the bgpM2CfgPeerTable. If the number of available entries in the bgpM2CfgPeerTable is exhausted, a retrieval value of this object instance will return 0. A value of 0 may also be returned if the agent is otherwise incapable of bgpM2CfgPeerTable row creation at the time of bgpM2CfgPeerNextIndex retrieval.

bgpM2CfgPeerTable.name: bgpM2CfgPeerTable
bgpM2CfgPeerTable.description: BGP configuration peer table. This table allows the configuration of the parameters for a session with a BGP peer. +++wayne provide description of how config should be done for a peer per table.

bgpM2CfgPeerEntry.name: bgpM2CfgPeerEntry
bgpM2CfgPeerEntry.description: Entry containing information set up by a management entity to configure a connection with a BGP peer.

bgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion.name: bgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion
bgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion.description: The configured version to originally start with this peer. The BGP speaker may permit negotiation to a lower version number of the protocol depending on the set value of bgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation.

bgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation.name: bgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation
bgpM2CfgAllowVersionNegotiation.description: If set to true, during session establishment with this peer, negotiation to a version lower than that specified in bgpM2CfgPeerConfiguredVersion will be allowed.

bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType.name: bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType
bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType.description: The address family of the speakers of this BGP session.

bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr.name: bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr
bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr.description: The address of the local end of the peering session.

bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAs.name: bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAs
bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAs.description: Autonomous system represented to peer on peering session initialization. Some implementations of BGP can represent themselves as multiple ASes. These implementations can set this to an alternate autonomous system. If this object is set to zero (0) at the point this row instance is set to active, then the implementation will initialize this session representing itself as the value of bgpM2CfgLocalAs.

bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddrType.name: bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddrType
bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddrType.description: The address family of the speakers of the remote BGP session.

bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr.name: bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr
bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr.description: The address of the remote end (destination address of peer) for peering session.

bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAs.name: bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAs
bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAs.description: Autonomous system number of the remote peer.

bgpM2CfgPeerEntryStorageType.name: bgpM2CfgPeerEntryStorageType
bgpM2CfgPeerEntryStorageType.description: This object type specifies the intended storage type for the bgpM2CfgPeerEntry row instance.

bgpM2CfgPeerError.name: bgpM2CfgPeerError
bgpM2CfgPeerError.description: This value indicates the current error status of the row denoting the configured error status. If this row is still under creation (has not been activated bgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus), then this instance will be set to not-activated (1). At the point that the row is activated, bgpM2CfgPeerError will reflect the error status of the row data itself. If there is another session already activated with the same local and remote addresses as denoted by {bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddrType, bgpM2CfgPeerLocalAddr, bgpM2CfgPeerRemoteAddr}, then the value of this will be set to err-duplicate-peering-session (2). If this row is associated with a peer session whose initialization has been attempted, the value will be set to activated (3) (and, bgpM2PeerCfgPeerEntry will be set to the row instance of the entry in the bgpM2PeerTable which reflects the state of the peering session). Note that this object only reflects the error as a function of the attempted activation of this row as containing data for a bgp peering session. The actual state of the session at the point of any protocol exchange or session state machine initiation is reflected in the bgpM2PeerTable row instance (as reflected through bgpM2CfgPeerPeerEntry) associated with this row instance.

bgpM2CfgPeerBgpPeerEntry.name: bgpM2CfgPeerBgpPeerEntry
bgpM2CfgPeerBgpPeerEntry.description: Upon activation of the session data contained in this row instance, this object points to an instance of a row within the bgpM2PeerTable reflecting the session in its initializing or operational state. Retrieval of this column instance will always yield a value of {0.0} unless the session has successfully been activated (via bgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus). Such row instances will always have a value of bgpM2CfgPeerError which is activated (3).

bgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus.name: bgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus
bgpM2CfgPeerRowEntryStatus.description: This object type is used to control creation, activation, and deletion of this row instance.

bgpM2CfgPeerIndex.name: bgpM2CfgPeerIndex
bgpM2CfgPeerIndex.description: Uniquely identifies an instance of a peer row, as an element of configuration.

bgpM2CfgPeerStatus.name: bgpM2CfgPeerStatus
bgpM2CfgPeerStatus.description: This specifies the state of the peering session upon activation. If disabled, the FSM is in the halted state and no Automatic Start events are generated. If enabled, the FSM is in the running state and Automatic Start events may be generated.

bgpM2CfgPeerTimersTable.name: bgpM2CfgPeerTimersTable
bgpM2CfgPeerTimersTable.description: Table for configuration of per-peer timers.

bgpM2CfgPeerConnectRetryInterval.name: bgpM2CfgPeerConnectRetryInterval
bgpM2CfgPeerConnectRetryInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the ConnectRetry timer. The suggested value for this timer is 120 seconds.

bgpM2CfgPeerHoldTimeConfigured.name: bgpM2CfgPeerHoldTimeConfigured
bgpM2CfgPeerHoldTimeConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the Hold Time configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. This value is placed in an OPEN message sent to this peer by this BGP speaker, and is compared with the Hold Time field in an OPEN message received from the peer when determining the Hold Time (bgpM2PeerHoldTime) with the peer. This value must not be less than three seconds if it is not zero (0) in which case the Hold Time is NOT to be established with the peer. The suggested value for this timer is 90 seconds.

bgpM2CfgPeerKeepAliveConfigured.name: bgpM2CfgPeerKeepAliveConfigured
bgpM2CfgPeerKeepAliveConfigured.description: Time interval in seconds for the KeepAlive timer configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. The value of this object will only determine the KEEPALIVE messages frequency relative to the value specified in bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured; the actual time interval for the KEEPALIVE messages is indicated by bgpM2PeerKeepAlive. A reasonable maximum value for this timer would be configured to be one third of that of bgpM2PeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), no periodical KEEPALIVE messages are sent to the peer after the BGP connection has been established. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

bgpM2CfgPeerMinASOrigInterval.name: bgpM2CfgPeerMinASOrigInterval
bgpM2CfgPeerMinASOrigInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinASOriginationInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 15 seconds.

bgpM2CfgPeerMinRouteAdverInter.name: bgpM2CfgPeerMinRouteAdverInter
bgpM2CfgPeerMinRouteAdverInter.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientTable.name: bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientTable
bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientTable.description: Table of route reflection client settings on a per-peer basis.

bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientEntry.name: bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientEntry
bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClientEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a route reflector client.

bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClient.name: bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClient
bgpM2CfgPeerReflectorClient.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is a reflector client of this router, or not. A value of nonClient indicates that this peer is not a reflector client. A value of client indicates that this peer is a reflector client that is not fully meshed with other reflector clients. A value of meshedClient indicates that the peer is a reflector client and is fully meshed with all other reflector clients. This value must be nonClient (0) for BGP external peers.

bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberTable.name: bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberTable
bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberTable.description: Table of confederation member settings on a per-peer basis.

bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberEntry.name: bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberEntry
bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMemberEntry.description: Entry containing data on a per-peer basis on whether the peer is configured as a BGP confederation member.

bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMember.name: bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMember
bgpM2CfgPeerConfedMember.description: This value indicates whether the given peer is in our confederation or not.

bgpM2NlriTable.name: bgpM2NlriTable
bgpM2NlriTable.description: The BGP-4 Received Path Attribute Table contains information about paths to destination networks received from all BGP4 peers. Collectively, this represents the Adj-Ribs-In. The route where bgpM2NlriBest is TRUE represents, for this NLRI, the route that is installed in the LocRib from the Adj-Ribs-In.

bgpM2NlriEntry.name: bgpM2NlriEntry
bgpM2NlriEntry.description: Information about a path to a network.

bgpM2NlriIndex.name: bgpM2NlriIndex
bgpM2NlriIndex.reference: RFC 3107 - Carrying Label Information in BGP-4
bgpM2NlriIndex.description: This index allows for multiple instances of a base prefix for a certain AFI SAFI from a given peer. This is currently useful for two things: 1. Allowing for a peer in future implementations to send more than a single route instance. 2. Allow for extensions which extend the NLRI field to send the same prefix while utilizing other extension specific information. An example of this is RFC 3107 - Carrying MPLS labels in BGP.

bgpM2NlriAfi.name: bgpM2NlriAfi
bgpM2NlriAfi.description: The address family of the prefix for this NLRI.

bgpM2NlriSafi.name: bgpM2NlriSafi
bgpM2NlriSafi.description: The subsequent address family of the prefix for this NLRI

bgpM2NlriPrefixType.name: bgpM2NlriPrefixType
bgpM2NlriPrefixType.description: The type of the IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field. The value of this object is derived from the appropriate value from the bgpM2NlriAfi field. Where an appropriate InetAddressType is not available, the value of the object must be unknown(0). XXX TODO - This seems like a hack.

bgpM2NlriPrefix.name: bgpM2NlriPrefix
bgpM2NlriPrefix.description: An IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field. This object is an IP address containing the prefix with length specified by bgpM2PathAttrAddrPrefixLen. Any bits beyond the length specified by bgpM2PathAttrAddrPrefixLen are zeroed.

bgpM2NlriPrefixLen.name: bgpM2NlriPrefixLen
bgpM2NlriPrefixLen.description: Length in bits of the address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field.

bgpM2NlriBest.name: bgpM2NlriBest
bgpM2NlriBest.description: An indication of whether or not this route was chosen as the best BGP4 route.

bgpM2NlriCalcLocalPref.name: bgpM2NlriCalcLocalPref
bgpM2NlriCalcLocalPref.description: The degree of preference calculated by the receiving BGP4 speaker for an advertised route.

bgpM2PathAttrIndex.name: bgpM2PathAttrIndex
bgpM2PathAttrIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the per-NLRI entry in the bgpM2PathAttrTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the bgpM2PathAttrTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of bgpM2PathAttrIndex row instance values across rows of the bgpM2PeerAttrTable. It is used to provide an index structure for other tables whose data is logically per-peer, per-NLRI.

bgpM2NlriOpaqueType.name: bgpM2NlriOpaqueType
bgpM2NlriOpaqueType.reference: RFC 3107 - Carrying Label Information in BGP-4 draft-ietf-mpls-lsr-mib-08.txt
bgpM2NlriOpaqueType.description: This object enumerates the type of the row that is pointed to in the table row bgpM2NlriOpaquePointer instance, if bgpM2NlriOpaquePointer is in fact not a zero length. bgpM2NlriOpaqueType is necessary since the data referenced by bgpM2NlriOpaquePointer is opaque to BGP. For example, in the case of RFC 3107, the label stack that is pointed to may occur in the mplsLabelStackTable from the MPLS-LSR-MIB, and the instance value of bgpM2NlriOpaqueType would be bgpMplsLabelStack(1).

bgpM2NlriOpaquePointer.name: bgpM2NlriOpaquePointer
bgpM2NlriOpaquePointer.description: Pointer to a row that decomposes the data that is opaque to the BGP MIB but is sent in the NLRI. This RowPointer has zero (0) length data instance if bgpM2NlriOpaqueType is none.

bgpM2AdjRibsOutTable.name: bgpM2AdjRibsOutTable
bgpM2AdjRibsOutTable.description: This table contains on a per-peer basis one or more routes from the bgpM2NlriTable that have been placed in this peer's Adj-Ribs-Out.

bgpM2AdjRibsOutEntry.name: bgpM2AdjRibsOutEntry
bgpM2AdjRibsOutEntry.description: List of BGP routes that have been placed into a peer's Adj-Ribs-Out.

bgpM2AdjRibsOutIndex.name: bgpM2AdjRibsOutIndex
bgpM2AdjRibsOutIndex.description: Certain extensions to BGP permit multiple instance of a per afi, per safi prefix to be advertised to a peer. This object allows the enumeration of them.

bgpM2AdjRibsOutRoute.name: bgpM2AdjRibsOutRoute
bgpM2AdjRibsOutRoute.description: This object points to the route in the bgpM2NlriTable that corresponds to the entry in the peer's Adj-Rib-Out. Outgoing route maps are not reflected at this point as those are part of the Update-Send process.

bgpM2PathAttrCount.name: bgpM2PathAttrCount
bgpM2PathAttrCount.description: The number of entries in the bgpM2PathAttrTable.

bgpM2PathAttrTable.name: bgpM2PathAttrTable
bgpM2PathAttrTable.description: Provides per advertised network-prefix attribute data, as advertised over a peering session.

bgpM2PathAttrEntry.name: bgpM2PathAttrEntry
bgpM2PathAttrEntry.description: Each entry contains data about a given network prefix, per-prefix and per-advertising peer.

bgpM2PathAttrOrigin.name: bgpM2PathAttrOrigin
bgpM2PathAttrOrigin.description: The ultimate origin of the path information.

bgpM2PathAttrNextHopAddrType.name: bgpM2PathAttrNextHopAddrType
bgpM2PathAttrNextHopAddrType.description: The address family of the address for the border router that should be used to access the destination network.

bgpM2PathAttrNextHop.name: bgpM2PathAttrNextHop
bgpM2PathAttrNextHop.description: The address of the border router that should be used to access the destination network. This address is the nexthop address received in the UPDATE packet. The address family of this object will be the same as that of the prefix in this row. Note that for RFC2545 style double nexthops, this object will always contain the global scope nexthop. bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable will contain the linklocal scope nexthop. In the case that the mechanism documented in draft-kato-bgp-ipv6-link-local-00.txt is used and only a link local nexthop has been sent, , bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent will be false and bgpM2PathAttrNextHop will contain the link local nexthop.

bgpM2PathAttrMedPresent.name: bgpM2PathAttrMedPresent
bgpM2PathAttrMedPresent.description: Whether or not the MED value is present. If it is not present, the bgpM2PathAttrMed object has no useful value and should be set to 0.

bgpM2PathAttrMed.name: bgpM2PathAttrMed
bgpM2PathAttrMed.description: This metric is used to discriminate between multiple exit points to an adjacent autonomous system.

bgpM2PathAttrLocalPrefPresent.name: bgpM2PathAttrLocalPrefPresent
bgpM2PathAttrLocalPrefPresent.description: Whether or not the LocalPref value is present. If it is not present, the bgpM2PathAttrLocalPref object has no useful value and should be set to 0.

bgpM2PathAttrLocalPref.name: bgpM2PathAttrLocalPref
bgpM2PathAttrLocalPref.description: The originating BGP4 speakers degree of preference for an advertised route.

bgpM2PathAttrAtomicAggregate.name: bgpM2PathAttrAtomicAggregate
bgpM2PathAttrAtomicAggregate.description: When this object is set to atomicAggregatePresent, the ATOMIC_AGGREGATE Path Attribute is present and indicates that the NLRI MUST NOT be made more specific.

bgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS.name: bgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS
bgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS.description: The AS number of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of zero (0) indicates the absence of this attribute. Note propagation of AS of zero is illegal in the Internet.

bgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAddr.name: bgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAddr
bgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAddr.description: The IP address of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates the absence of this attribute.

bgpM2AsPathCalcLength.name: bgpM2AsPathCalcLength
bgpM2AsPathCalcLength.description: This value represents the calculated length of the AS Path according to the rules of the BGP specification. This value is used in route selection.

bgpM2AsPathString.name: bgpM2AsPathString
bgpM2AsPathString.description: This is a string depicting the autonomous system path to this network which was received from the peer which advertised it. The format of the string is implementation-dependent, and should be designed for operator readability.

bgpM2AsPathIndex.name: bgpM2AsPathIndex
bgpM2AsPathIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the decomposed AS Path in the bgpM2AsPathTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the bgpM2AsPathTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of bgpM2AsPathIndex row instance values across rows of the bgpM2AsPathTable.

bgpM2AsPath4byteTable.name: bgpM2AsPath4byteTable
bgpM2AsPath4byteTable.reference: draft-ietf-idr-as4bytes-04.txt - BGP support for four-octet AS number space
bgpM2AsPath4byteTable.description: This table is present for BGP speakers that support the AS 4byte specification and are functioning as a router between 2-byte and 4-byte AS space.

bgpM2AsPath4byteEntry.name: bgpM2AsPath4byteEntry
bgpM2AsPath4byteEntry.description: Each row contains the information for the AS 4-byte extension's NEW_AS_PATH and NEW_AGGREGATOR attributes.

bgpM2AsPath4bytePathPresent.name: bgpM2AsPath4bytePathPresent
bgpM2AsPath4bytePathPresent.description: This value may only be true if this BGP Speaker is functioning as a router between ASs that are in 2-byte and 4-byte AS space. If this value is true, then the NEW_AS_PATH attributes are present and the 4-byte versions of the appropriate path attributes are in this row. If this value is false, then the following values will be present in the row: bgpM2PathAttrAggregatorAS - zero (0). bgpM2AsPathCalcLength - zero (0). bgpM2AsPathString - zero (0) length string. bgpM2AsPathIndex - zero (0).

bgpM2AsPath4byteAggregatorAS.name: bgpM2AsPath4byteAggregatorAS
bgpM2AsPath4byteAggregatorAS.description: The NEW_AGGREGATOR AS number of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of zero (0) indicates the absence of this attribute. Note propagation of AS of zero is illegal in the Internet.

bgpM2AsPath4byteCalcLength.name: bgpM2AsPath4byteCalcLength
bgpM2AsPath4byteCalcLength.description: This value represents the calculated length of the NEW_AS_PATH according to the rules of the BGP specification. This value is used in route selection.

bgpM2AsPath4byteString.name: bgpM2AsPath4byteString
bgpM2AsPath4byteString.description: This is a string depicting the autonomous system path to this network which was received from the peer which advertised it. The format of the string is implementation-dependent, and should be designed for operator readability.

bgpM2AsPath4byteIndex.name: bgpM2AsPath4byteIndex
bgpM2AsPath4byteIndex.description: This value is a unique index for the decomposed AS Path in the bgpM2AsPathTable. It is assigned by the agent at the point of creation of the bgpM2AsPathTable row entry. While its value is guaranteed to be unique at any time, it is otherwise opaque to the management application with respect to its value or the contiguity of bgpM2AsPathIndex row instance values across rows of the bgpM2AsPathTable.

bgpM2AsPathTable.name: bgpM2AsPathTable
bgpM2AsPathTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute AS Path Table contains the per network path (NLRI) AS PATH data received from the advertising BGP peer.

bgpM2AsPathTableEntry.name: bgpM2AsPathTableEntry
bgpM2AsPathTableEntry.description: Information about an AS path provided with a path to a network.

bgpM2AsPathSegmentIndex.name: bgpM2AsPathSegmentIndex
bgpM2AsPathSegmentIndex.description: A per-AS path segment index. This will index a set of autonomous systems in an AS path which are part of the same sequence or set (as determined by the row value of bgpM2AsPathType, which should be the same value for each bgpM2AsPathTable entry indexed by the same (bgpM2PathAttrIndex, bgpM2AsPathIndex) pair).

bgpM2AsPathElementIndex.name: bgpM2AsPathElementIndex
bgpM2AsPathElementIndex.description: A per-AS element index. This will index a particular AS within a sequence or set of autonomous systems in an AS path.

bgpM2AsPathType.name: bgpM2AsPathType
bgpM2AsPathType.description: The type of sequence in which this asPath was advertised as an attribute. Note that all asPath row instances for a given (bgpM2PathAttrIndex, bgpM2AsPathIndex) index pair will have their bgpM2AsPathType set to the same value. The values for bgpM2AsPathType are interpreted as defined in the base BGP document and the BGP AS Confederations document.

bgpM2AsPathElementValue.name: bgpM2AsPathElementValue
bgpM2AsPathElementValue.description: An AS value for an AS the related NLRI traversed in the propagation of its advertisement. This value is to be interpreted in the context of the sequence implied by bgpM2AsPathIndex and bgpM2AsPathType (and, in sequence of the other table rows with the same value of bgpM2PathAttrIndex and bgpM2AsPathIndex).

bgpM2PathAttrUnknownTable.name: bgpM2PathAttrUnknownTable
bgpM2PathAttrUnknownTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Unknown Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the path attributes advertised with a route but not known to the local BGP implementation or not otherwise capable of being returned from this agent. The absence of row data for a given index value for bgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of such unknown attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that bgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the bgpM2PathAttrTable).

bgpM2PathAttrUnknownEntry.name: bgpM2PathAttrUnknownEntry
bgpM2PathAttrUnknownEntry.description: Information about an unknown attribute provided with a path to a network.

bgpM2PathAttrUnknownIndex.name: bgpM2PathAttrUnknownIndex
bgpM2PathAttrUnknownIndex.description: An integer index for a row in this table.

bgpM2PathAttrUnknownType.name: bgpM2PathAttrUnknownType
bgpM2PathAttrUnknownType.description: The attribute type advertised with this unknown attribute by the peer.

bgpM2PathAttrUnknownValue.name: bgpM2PathAttrUnknownValue
bgpM2PathAttrUnknownValue.description: Value of path attribute not understood by the base BGP-4 document. Octets beyond the maximum size, if any, are not recorded by this row object.

bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdTable.name: bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdTable
bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdTable.description: Per prefix data pertinent to advertisement of a network prefix through an originator.

bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdEntry.name: bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdEntry
bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorIdEntry.description: Each entry contains data pertinent to a network prefix as received through its originating BGP route reflector.

bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorId.name: bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorId
bgpM2PathAttrOriginatorId.description: The Originator-ID identifying the router that initially advertised this destination to a Route Reflector. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates the absence of this attribute.

bgpM2PathAttrClusterTable.name: bgpM2PathAttrClusterTable
bgpM2PathAttrClusterTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Cluster Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the reflection path which a route has traversed. The absence of row data for a given index value for bgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of this attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that bgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the bgpM2PathAttrTable).

bgpM2PathAttrClusterEntry.name: bgpM2PathAttrClusterEntry
bgpM2PathAttrClusterEntry.description: Information about a cluster traversal provided with a path to a network.

bgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex.name: bgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex
bgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex.description: An integral index for a row in this table.

bgpM2PathAttrClusterValue.name: bgpM2PathAttrClusterValue
bgpM2PathAttrClusterValue.description: A four octet long value representing a part of the reflection path that the route has passed. Each such four octet long value represents the ID of a cluster that the route has traversed. The sequence of this path as received in the route advertisement will be preserved in the sequence of bgpM2PathAttrClusterTable rows (and the bgpM2PathAttrClusterValues in each row) as returned for a given bgpM2PathAttrIndex value, and the monotonically increasing sequence of bgpM2PathAttrClusterIndex values for that bgpM2PathAttrIndex.

bgpM2PathAttrCommTable.name: bgpM2PathAttrCommTable
bgpM2PathAttrCommTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Community Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the community membership advertised with a route. The absence of row data for a given index value for bgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of this attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that bgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the bgpM2PathAttrTable).

bgpM2PathAttrCommEntry.name: bgpM2PathAttrCommEntry
bgpM2PathAttrCommEntry.description: Information about a community association provided with a path to a network.

bgpM2PathAttrCommIndex.name: bgpM2PathAttrCommIndex
bgpM2PathAttrCommIndex.description: An integer index for a row in this table.

bgpM2PathAttrCommValue.name: bgpM2PathAttrCommValue
bgpM2PathAttrCommValue.description: A value representing a community. There are certain 4-octet long values which could be returned in this columnar row data that carry additional semantics.

bgpM2PathAttrExtCommTable.name: bgpM2PathAttrExtCommTable
bgpM2PathAttrExtCommTable.description: The BGP-4 Path Attribute Community Table contains the per network path (NLRI) data on the extended community membership advertised with a route. The absence of row data for a given index value for bgpM2PathAttrIndex indicates a lack of this attribute information for the indicated network path (as indexed by that bgpM2PathAttrIndex value in the bgpM2PathAttrTable). XXX JMH - can not assign the OID until an RFC is published.

bgpM2PathAttrExtCommEntry.name: bgpM2PathAttrExtCommEntry
bgpM2PathAttrExtCommEntry.description: Information about an extended community association provided with a path to a network.

bgpM2PathAttrExtCommIndex.name: bgpM2PathAttrExtCommIndex
bgpM2PathAttrExtCommIndex.description: An integral index for a row in this table.

bgpM2PathAttrExtCommValue.name: bgpM2PathAttrExtCommValue
bgpM2PathAttrExtCommValue.description: A value representing an extended community which was received with the route implied by the bgpM2PathAttr Index value of this row data. There are certain 8-octet long values which could be returned in this columnar row data that carry additional semantics.

bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable.name: bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable
bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable.reference: RFC 2545 - Use of BGP-4 Multiprotocol Extensions for IPv6 Inter-Domain Routing
bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopTable.description: Table of link local nexthops as sent by RFC 2545 for IPv6 BGP Speakers.

bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopEntry.name: bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopEntry
bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopEntry.description: Entry containing the link-local nexthops as sent by a BGP speaker running RFC 2545 extensions for double-nexthops.

bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent.name: bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent
bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent.description: This value is TRUE if and only if the BGP speaker is receiving IPv6 NLRI using the RFC 2545 double nexthop convention and it has received a link local scope nexthop in addition to the global scope nexthop.

bgpM2LinkLocalNextHop.name: bgpM2LinkLocalNextHop
bgpM2LinkLocalNextHop.description: This value contains an IPv6 link local address of InetAddressType of type ipv6z. This value is only present if bgpM2LinkLocalNextHopPresent is true.

bgpM2MIBCompliance.name: bgpM2MIBCompliance
bgpM2MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the BGP4 mib.

bgpM2ExtCommunitiesGroup.name: bgpM2ExtCommunitiesGroup
bgpM2ExtCommunitiesGroup.description: Objects associated with BGP extended communities.

bgpM2RouteReflectionGroup.name: bgpM2RouteReflectionGroup
bgpM2RouteReflectionGroup.description: Objects associated with BGP route reflection.

bgpM2AsConfederationGroup.name: bgpM2AsConfederationGroup
bgpM2AsConfederationGroup.description: Objects associated with BGP confederation membership.

bgpM2TimersGroup.name: bgpM2TimersGroup
bgpM2TimersGroup.description: Objects associated with BGP peering timers.

bgpM2CountersGroup.name: bgpM2CountersGroup
bgpM2CountersGroup.description: Objects to count discrete events and exchanges on BGP sessions.

bgpM2CapabilitiesGroup.name: bgpM2CapabilitiesGroup
bgpM2CapabilitiesGroup.description: Objects to report capabilities as received on BGP sessions.

bgpM2AsPathGroup.name: bgpM2AsPathGroup
bgpM2AsPathGroup.description: Objects to report AS paths received on BGP NLRIs.

bgpM2BaseGroup.name: bgpM2BaseGroup
bgpM2BaseGroup.description: Basic objects in local BGP implementation.

bgpM2ErrorsGroup.name: bgpM2ErrorsGroup
bgpM2ErrorsGroup.description: Errors received on BGP peering sessions.

bgpM2PeerGroup.name: bgpM2PeerGroup
bgpM2PeerGroup.description: Core object types on BGP peering sessions.

bgpM2PathAttributesGroup.name: bgpM2PathAttributesGroup
bgpM2PathAttributesGroup.description: Attributes received on BGP peering sessions.

bgpM2PeerRouteReflectorCfgGroup.name: bgpM2PeerRouteReflectorCfgGroup
bgpM2PeerRouteReflectorCfgGroup.description: Configuration objects for BGP peers that support route reflection.

bgpM2PeerAsConfederationCfgGroup.name: bgpM2PeerAsConfederationCfgGroup
bgpM2PeerAsConfederationCfgGroup.description: Configuration objects for BGP peers that support BGP confederations.

bgpM2MIBNotificationsGroup.name: bgpM2MIBNotificationsGroup
